title: Accused in Dinajpurâ€™s NGO woman rape case held in Rangpur
body: The Rapid Action Battalion arrested the accused in the rape of a woman working in an NGO in Dinajpur at Nur Pathan Para village under Pirgachha in Rangpur on Friday. The arrested Md Masum Reza Mukul, 47, is a resident of Ratanpur village under Birampur in Dinajpur, said a press release. Citing the statement in the complaint filed by the plaintiff, the release said that the NGO employee victim woman had been living as a tenant in the house of the arrested accused Md Masum Reza Mukul for the past three years. While living as a tenant, the arrested accused often made sexual advances to her. When she rejected his sexual advances, the accused fraudulently entered her bedroom and forcibly raped her and took away two tolas of gold ornaments and cash of Tk 1.38 lakh kept in her cupboard. The victim herself filed a complaint with the court, and the court ordered Birampur police to accept the complaint of the accused and file an FIR and the Birampur police recorded a rape case on November 24. On a tip-off, a joint team of the RAB 13, Dinajpur camp and Rangpur Sadar company, conducted a raid in Nur Pathan Para village and arrested Masum Reza Mukul. The arrested has been handed over to Birampur police for further legal action.
